intro: Marsypianthes hyptoides var. calycina, commonly known as the calycine marshmallow, is a herbaceous perennial native to the wetlands of Southeast Asia. It features a low-growing, sprawling habit with soft, fleshy stems that are often covered in a fine, white pubescence. The plant produces small, clustered white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate to elliptic, and have a velvety texture. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported soothing and anti-inflammatory properties.
